intro: Cacalia rugulosa, commonly known as the roughleaf cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are rough and often have a mottled appearance, while its flowers are small and clustered in a rounded head. Cacalia rugulosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
